business.headline: Mother Dairy raises milk prices by up to Rs 2 per litreThe price revision will be effective from April 30, 2025 across its market, a company official said on Tuesday.

IndusInd Bank CEO Sumant Kathpalia resigns after derivatives accounting lapseThe accounting lapse, which pertained to internal derivative trades, had a negative impact on the bank's profit and loss statement and its net worth. In his resignation letter, Kathpalia wrote, "I undertake moral responsibility, given the various acts of commission/omission that have been brought to my notice."

Tata plant begins iPhone production in India as Apple pivots from tariff-hit ChinaThe new Tata facility in Hosur, southern India, has begun rolling out older iPhone models on a single production line. Meanwhile, Foxconn's upcoming $2.6 billion factory in Karnataka's capital is expected to start trial production of the iPhone 16 series shortly, sources told the news agency.

Osamu Suzuki conferred with Padma Vibhushan for contribution to auto industryOsamu Suzuki, former Chairman of Suzuki Motor Corporation and ex-Director & Honorary Chairman of Maruti Suzuki India Limited, was posthumously honoured with the Padma Vibhushan, the country's second-highest civilian award.

Sensex, Nifty close flat after volatile trade as border tensions weigh on marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 70 points to close at 80,288.38, while the NSE Nifty50 just managed to end in green, adding 7.45 points to close at 24,335.95.

Sebi probes Ola Electric's sales data disclosures: ReportThe matter came into focus after a big gap was seen between the vehicle registration data on the government's VAHAN portal and the sales numbers shared by the company.

Terror's price tag: How the Pahalgam attack could hit Pakistan's economyAlready struggling with a weak economy, Pakistan now faces even tougher times ahead as India's retaliatory steps threaten to break crucial economic links.

Infosys sacks 195 trainees over failed internal tests: ReportThe move marks the fourth such round of trainee terminations at India's second-largest IT services company, which is grappling with weak demand and flat revenue projections for the current fiscal year.

Dalal Street faces high volatility, but there is good news for investorsBy mid-morning, the Sensex was up around 100 points and holding above 80,302, while the Nifty50 traded above 24,300. That resilience marks a big shift from just a few weeks ago when even a whisper of bad news could send stocks crashing.
Explained: Why are gold prices not rising any moreGlobally, gold prices also dropped nearly 1%. Spot gold was down 0.8% at $3,314.99 an ounce, while US gold futures lost 0.7% to $3,325.10.

Ather Energy IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription details, GMP and key datesAther Energy IPO Day 2: The IPO will remain open till April 30, giving investors a couple more days to weigh their options. Ather's offering is a combination of fresh shares and an offer-for-sale from existing investors.

Gensol Engineering shares hit 52-week low after ED raids officesGensol ED raid: The company's stock continued to face heavy selling pressure, falling to Rs 81.36, which is its 52-week low. Gensol shares have now lost over 50% of their value in the last one month and nearly 90% over the past six months.

entertainment.headline: TikTok's Delaney Rowe sparks romance buzz with actor B.J. NovakB.J. Novak and TikTok star Delaney Rowe are rumoured to be dating after multiple public sightings, though reps haven't confirmed. Fans on social media continue speculating about their relationship status.

First Look: Dwayne Johnson unrecognizable as Mark Kerr in The Smashing MachineDwayne Johnson transforms to play MMA legend Mark Kerr in The Smashing Machine, a gritty A24 sports drama exploring fame, addiction, and resilience. The film hits theaters October 3, 2025.

Ken Carson announces 2025 Arena tour after 'More Chaos' tops Billboard 200Following his chart-topping album More Chaos, Ken Carson announces a 30-city North American arena tour starting July 2025, marking a milestone moment in his rapidly rising hip-hop career.

Sam Asghari debuts romance with Brooke Irvine at LGBTQ+ Hotel OpeningSam Asghari debuted his relationship with Brooke Irvine at a Puerto Vallarta LGBTQ+ hotel launch, expressing allyship, joining stars like Demi Lovato, and reflecting on life post-Britney Spears.

Fan builds temple for Samantha on her 38th birthday in Andhra Pradesh. WatchA temple in the name of actor Samantha has been constructed by a fan in Bapatla, Andhra Pradesh. The fan marked the actor's 38th birthday by organising a meal for orphans.

Suniel Shetty calls Hera Pheri 'Deshbhakti' film: It keeps the country happyAt the trailer launch of 'Kesari Veer', Suniel Shetty shared his thoughts on 'Hera Pheri', describing it as a patriotic film. The actor stated that the movie promotes joy and mental well-being, which, in his view, embodies true 'deshbhakti'.

Producers Bhushan Kumar and Kumar Mangat confirm Raid 3Ajay Devgn returns as the righteous officer Amey Patnaik in Raid 2, set to release on May 1, as producers confirm a third instalment is already in the works. The sequel brings a fresh cast with Riteish Deshmukh as the antagonist and Vaani Kapoor replacing Ileana D'Cruz.

Ajith Kumar on Padma Bhushan honour: Still plain middle class at heartTamil actor Ajith Kumar was honoured with the Padma Bhushan on Monday. In an exclusive conversation with India Today, the 'Vidaamuyarchi' actor described the recognition as "surreal and overwhelming".

SRK in talks with Marvel Studios for Hollywood debut? Viral post sparks buzzShah Rukh Khan is set to make his Hollywood debut. The superstar is in talks with Marvel Studios for a potential role in the MCU.

Weak Hero Class 2 review: K-drama packs solid punch despite weak character arcsReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Weak Hero Class 2 review: Park Ji-hoon is back with a bang in the sequel to the popular K-drama adapted from manhwa, but the series compromises on character arcs to reach a hurried end.

Kesari Veer trailer: Sooraj Pancholi is Rajput warrior Hamirji Gohil in period dramaThe trailer of 'Kesari Veer', an upcoming period drama based on the life of Hamirji Gohil, is out. The titular character is played by actor Sooraj Pancholi.

Suniel Shetty condemns terrorism, says 'some can't see Kashmir progressing post-370'Actor Suniel Shetty talked about terrorism in Kashmir in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack. He appreciated the government's efforts to bring normalcy and progress in the Valley, but also slammed those who don't want Kashmir to grow.

Actor Nani reacts strongly to Pahalgam attack: Just take the terrorists outTelugu actor Nani, in an exclusive conversation with India Today, opened up about the Pahalgam terror attack. He said that there's only one way to combat terrorism and that is to wipe them out.

Mahesh Babu flaunts curly long hair look for SSMB 29 in new pics, fans reactMahesh Babu's latest photos have taken over the internet. Fans were excited to see him in a never-seen-before look for his upcoming film, 'SSMB 29', with director SS Rajamouli.

Miss our jhal muri: Shoojit Sircar squeezes his heart into tearful note to IrrfanOn Irrfan's fifth death anniversary, filmmaker Shoojit Sircar posted an emotional letter recalling their cherished memories and the lasting love for the late actor.
Babil Khan's emotional tribute to father Irrfan on death anniversaryActor Babil Khan shared an adorable post on his father and iconic actor Irrfan's death anniversary.

Dipika Kakar condemns Pahalgam terror attack: Why such anger?Actor Dipika Kakar condemned the recent Pahalgam terror attack. The actor, in her latest vlog, expressed her grief and condoled the death of innocent people.

Emraan Hashmi says 'terrorism has no religion', seeks Pahalgam attack 'payback'Actor Emraan Hashmi comments on the security at the Baisaran meadow during the terrorist attack. He also talks about solidarity, highlighting that no religion teaches violence.

Nani denies Salman's South ignores Bollywood claim: How did they turn superstars?Actor Nani dismissed Salman Khan's statement about the South audience not watching Bollywood films due to their loyalty to South superstars. He clarified that it's not possible for Khan and other actors from Bollywood to become such huge stars without being popular in the South.

general news.headline: PM gives full operational freedom to forces for Pahalgam attack response: SourcesPrime Minister Narendra Modi's high-level meeting with the top defence establishment came as India considers options to punish those behind the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack.

Within 36 hours: Another Pak minister fears Indian retaliation over J&K attackPakistan's Information Minister Attaullah Tarar warned of a possible Indian military strike within 24 to 36 hours, citing credible intelligence. This comes amid tensions between both countries in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack, which claimed 26 lives.

Congress deletes headless poster of PM on X, 'internal row' within partyThe Congress party has deleted a headless poster of Prime Minister Narendra Modi from its official X handle, following an "internal row" within the party.

Harvard faces backlash for hosting Pak officials after Pahalgam terror attackA recent Pakistan conference at Harvard's South Asia Institute drew backlash from Indian students after top Pakistani officials attended just days after the Pahalgam terror attack. Harvard later removed event details online.

A Carneyval for India-Canada ties after K-flop?Liberal Party leader Mark Carney is all set to start a full term as Canada's Prime Minister. All through, Carney tried to distance himself from his predecessor, Justin Trudeau, who turned Indo-Canadian ties chilly. With pro-Khalistani NDP leader Jagmeet Singh out of the way, and the economist and investor in Carney aware of India's economic value, will Canada's ties with India see an upswing?
14 killed after fire breaks out in hotel in Kolkata14 killed after fire breaks out in hotel in Kolkata

Mysuru entrepreneur, wife and son found dead at US home, murder-suicide suspectedHarshavardhana Kikkeri, a Microsoft alumnus from Mysuru, died by suicide and his wife and son were found shot dead inside their townhouse near Washington.

IPL 2025: KKR keep playoff hopes alive as stand-in captain Narine stuns DCStand-in skipper Sunil Narine stepped up in a must-win game, guiding KKR to a vital win over DC and keeping their playoff hopes alive in a high-pressure IPL 2025 clash in Delhi.

Australian woman's viral video on India's house help culture divides InternetIn a video on Instagram, Bree Steele opened up about how different daily life looks in India as compared to the West, especially when it comes to household chores.

Why attack on SP MP Ramji Lal Suman's convoy is a law and order red flag for UPThe Samajwadi Party leader has been in the crosshairs of the Karni Sena and other Rajput groups ever since his comments on the community's icon Rana Sanga and Babur

How Hanuman Garhi priest's Ayodhya Ram Mandir visit will create historyThe chief priest of Ayodhya's Hanuman Garhi Temple, Mahant Prem Das, will break a centuries-old "constitutional" rule on Wednesday by leaving the temple premises to visit the newly built Ram Mandir in Ayodhya. The Mahant isn't supposed to venture out of the shrine. Here's why Das is making the historic visit and what it means.

3 killed, several injured after shooting at hair salon in SwedenAt least three people have died and several others were injured in a shooting at a hair salon in Sweden's Uppsala city. Officials found several people with injuries consistent with gunshot wounds.

Aadhaar, PAN, Ration Card not enough: Government lists valid citizenship documentsIndian authorities have stated that Aadhaar, PAN, and ration cards are not definitive proof of citizenship. Instead, only birth and domicile certificates are recognised as conclusive evidence.

Flight chaos at Delhi airport as over 400 arrivals delayed for 2 days. Here's whyOn Tuesday, Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL) issued an advisory, stating that due to a shifting wind pattern in the vicinity of the airport, certain airline operations may experience delays.

'I'd like to be Pope': Donald Trump jokes on papal successionDonald Trump joked he'd like to be Pope when asked about the next pontiff, while noting Cardinal Timothy Dolan of New York could be a strong choice, though he has no preference.

White House official ducks question on US making Pakistan do its 'dirty work'Amid rising tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack, the US is urging India and Pakistan to avoid escalation. Secretary of State Marco Rubio plans to speak with both nations' foreign ministers as Washington pushes for peace through diplomatic channels.

Forget Indus waters, Pakistan has huge canal crisis at homeMassive protests in Sindh have forced the Pakistani government to shelve an Indus canals project that was reportedly intended to serve the interests of the army. Despite the government's announcement, people haven't lifted a blockade of the highways in Sindh, cutting off Punjab and transport to and from the Karachi Port. A lakh truckers and helpers are stranded, and fresh woe grips Pakistan's tattered economy.

How to make Pakistan pay for Pahalgam carnage: The hard optionsFrom missile attacks to surgical strikes and diplomatic pressure, each action will come with consequences, and not just for our recalcitrant neighbour.

RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat meets PM Modi at his residence: SourcesMohan Bhagwat met Narendra Modi at his residence on Tuesday evening, just hours after the Prime Minister chaired a high-level security meeting on the Pahalgam terror attack.

India tariff talks going great, think we'll have a deal: Donald TrumpPresident Donald Trump is optimistic over US-India trade talks, citing progress. Treasury Secretary Bessent on Monday indicated India may be amongst the first to finalise a deal.

Raja Ravi Varma: The story of God's and Goddesses' first paintingsRaja Ravi Varma, often called India's king of kitsch, crossed the narrow lines of courtly painting. He brought the gods from temples to the walls of the masses, shaping their form through paint and print both. Doing so, he stirred the stagnant waters of tradition, choosing not to gratify the few, but to speak to the many.

Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla will launch to Space Station on May 29He will serve as the pilot on the Ax-4 mission, joining an international crew led by veteran NASA astronaut Peggy Whitson, along with astronauts from Poland and Hungary.

Bengaluru restaurant valets crash Rs 1.4 crore Mercedes while making reelsThree valets with a Bengaluru restaurant crashed a Rs 1.4 crore luxury SUV while filming reels. According to the vehicle's owner, the restaurant first dismissed it as a parking accident, but it turned out to be a part of a larger coverup to hide that drivers didn't have valid licences.

Pahalgam zip line operator chanting Allahu Akbar natural reaction: NIA sourcesNIA sources said that it is natural to say 'Allahu Akbar' in reaction to something shocking or sudden and that it's the same as Hindus saying 'Hey Ram'.

sports.headline: Struggling Novak Djokovic pulls out of Rome ahead of French Open 2025Novak Djokovic's absence from the Italian Open only deepens concerns over his form and fitness ahead of the French Open, as his recent slump raises questions about what lies ahead for the tennis icon.

PBKS's James Hope wary of CSK threat: Teams with nothing to lose are dangerousIPL 2025: Despite CSK's poor form, PBKS pace coach James Hopes believes their 'nothing to lose' attitude makes them especially dangerous, as Punjab gear up for a high-stakes clash with the five-time champions.

DC vs KKR: Axar Patel provides update on injury, hopes to get fit for SRH clashDelhi Capitals captain Axar Patel regretted giving away extra runs in the powerplay after his team's 14-run loss against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in Match 48 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Women's tri series: India fined for slow over rate in opening game vs Sri LankaIndian women's cricket team has been fined for maintaining slow over rate during their opening game of the tri-series against Sri Lanka at R.Premadasa Stadium, Colombo.

IPL 2025: KKR keep playoff hopes alive as stand-in captain Narine stuns DCStand-in skipper Sunil Narine stepped up in a must-win game, guiding KKR to a vital win over DC and keeping their playoff hopes alive in a high-pressure IPL 2025 clash in Delhi.

IPL 2025: Chameera joins best catch contender with diving stunner in DelhiDelhi Capitals (DC) fast bowler Dushmantha Chameera took a breathtaking diving catch to dismiss Anukul Roy for a golden duck against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in Match 48 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

KL Rahul's Bengaluru celebration still gives me goosebumps: Suniel ShettyIPL 2025: Suniel Shetty said he enjoyed his son-in-law KL Rahul's celebration after helping Delhi Capitals win in Bengaluru earlier this season. The Bollywood actor also shed light on Rahul's remodelled approach to T20 cricket.

Our main focus is still to try and win all the matches: CSK batting coachChennai Super Kings (CSK) batting coach Michael Hussey has said that their team's focus is still to win all the remaining matches as they take on Punjab Kings in their tenth fixture of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Venkatesh Iyer's season is over: Fans on KKR star after 4th single-digit knockVenkatesh Iyer's struggles in IPL 2025 reached new lows with a fourth single-digit score, sparking fan outrage over his Rs 23.75 crore price tag and raising serious questions about KKR's top-order batting reliability.

Rachin Ravindra, Deepak Hooda happy to make way for youngsters: Michael HusseyChennai Super Kings (CSK) batting coach Michael Hussey revealed how Rachin Ravindra and Deepak Hooda took their snub from the playingXI sportingly and were happy to make way for the youngsters.

PV Sindhu, HS Prannoy flop as India's wait for semis berth continuesSudirman Cup 2025: India's chances of reaching the semi-finals of the prestigious mixed team tournament ended early. After losing to Denmark on Sunday, they were outclassed by former champions Indonesia 1-4 on Tuesday in China.

KL Rahul's Bengaluru celebration still gives me goosebumps: Suniel ShettyIPL 2025: Suniel Shetty said he enjoyed his son-in-law KL Rahul's celebration after helping Delhi Capitals win in Bengaluru earlier this season. The Bollywood actor also shed light on Rahul's remodelled approach to T20 cricket.

Our main focus is still to try and win all the matches: CSK batting coachChennai Super Kings (CSK) batting coach Michael Hussey has said that their team's focus is still to win all the remaining matches as they take on Punjab Kings in their tenth fixture of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Venkatesh Iyer's season is over: Fans on KKR star after 4th single-digit knockVenkatesh Iyer's struggles in IPL 2025 reached new lows with a fourth single-digit score, sparking fan outrage over his Rs 23.75 crore price tag and raising serious questions about KKR's top-order batting reliability.

Rachin Ravindra, Deepak Hooda happy to make way for youngsters: Michael HusseyChennai Super Kings (CSK) batting coach Michael Hussey revealed how Rachin Ravindra and Deepak Hooda took their snub from the playingXI sportingly and were happy to make way for the youngsters.

PV Sindhu, HS Prannoy flop as India's wait for semis berth continuesSudirman Cup 2025: India's chances of reaching the semi-finals of the prestigious mixed team tournament ended early. After losing to Denmark on Sunday, they were outclassed by former champions Indonesia 1-4 on Tuesday in China.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
